answerText: The Tin Drum [or Die Blechtrommel][10] Paul Pokriefke is born as the Wilhelm Gustloff sinks, and his neo-Nazi son Konny shoots the Jewish Wolfgang Stremplin in this novel by Günter Grass.
heading: ACF Regionals |2013 | Schindler + Yale C + Minnesota B | 17 | Literature | European | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: Answer some questions about Günter Grass novels, for 10 points each.  [10] This most famous Grass novel is the first of his Danzig Trilogy. In it, Oskar Matzerath chooses to stop growing at age three after receiving the title instrument.
